This paper proposes a new metric, Urgency of Information (UoI), to evaluate the timeliness of status updates in remote monitoring and control systems. The paper discusses the limitations of the existing metric, Age of Information (AoI), and how UoI overcomes those limitations by incorporating time-varying context information and dynamic status evolution. The paper also proposes an update-index-based adaptive scheme to minimize the average UoI for a status update terminal with an updating frequency constraint. Based on these topics, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are Networked Systems (cs.NI), Systems and Control (cs.SY), Information Theory (cs.IT), Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), and Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC).
